definitions.definition: Ellipsis of thymus gland ( “ A ductless gland, consisting mainly of lymphatic tissue, located behind the top of the breastbone . It is most active during puberty , after which it shrinks in size. It plays an important role in the development of the immune system and produces lymphocytes . ” ) .

main_definition: ( anatomy , immunology ) Ellipsis of thymus gland ( “ A ductless gland, consisting mainly of lymphatic tissue, located behind the top of the breastbone . It is most active during puberty , after which it shrinks in size. It plays an important role in the development of the immune system and produces lymphocytes . ” ) .
